Stat 340.Name: Data Science Modeling II
Stat 340.Description: Teaches how to apply statistical methods to learn from data. Topics include one- and two-sample inference; an introduction to Bayesian inference and associated probability theory; linear and logistic regression models; the bootstrap; and cross-validation. An integrated statistical computing environment is used to explore and analyze data, develop models, make inferences, and communicate results in a reproducible manner through a project-oriented approach to learning.
Stat 340.SubjectNotes: This is the statistics department. Have an enrollment question? Visit https://stat.wisc.edu/courses-and-enrollment/.
